General course objectives:
General course objectives
The main objective is for the students to be able to carry out a structural design of a multi-storey building consisting of mainly precast concrete elements.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Explain the structural system of a multi-storey precast concrete building
Explain how requirements and non-structural elements influence the structural system
Determine and calculate the relevant load actions on a building
Describe the load path through a building
Analyze a precast concrete building subjected to vertical loads and design a load carrying system
Analyze the stability of a precast concrete building subjected to horizontal loads and design a bracing system
Evaluate individual elements in service state and ultimate limit state
Apply relevant joints in connections between precast concrete elements
Content:
The course mainly consists of lectures and project work in groups with sub-assignments. In the project group, the students design a multi-storey precast concrete building based on the topics from the lectures and most often in accordance with the European standards. Some of the methods learned are also applicable for buildings of other materials.
The students are graded based on the assessment of one or two reports about topics from the project work. The students will get formative feedback during the course, e.g. via peer assessment.
Some of the topics are: Load combinations, design of horizontal and vertical members, stabilizing walls, the rigid floor method, structural joints etc.
